visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing monthly real estate sales patterns using synthetic market data with seasonal variation
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains univariate time-series data with 12 monthly observations. Synthetic values follow a seasonal pattern (μ=60.2, σ=14.3) reflecting typical real estate market behavior: winter trough (Jan: 42 units), spring growth (+40% Jan-May), summer peak (Jun: 84 units), and autumn decline. Data incorporates two statistical properties - linear trend (R²=0.76 Jan-Jul) and seasonal cyclicity. The column chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating redundant gridlines and legend while using Cairo's preattentive principles through color intensity (teal bars on light background) and proportional encoding. Axis labels follow Tufte's minimalist design with subtle gray tones, and y-axis formatting uses D3-style comma separation for thousands. Synthetic data maintains domain validity through realistic transaction ranges and industry-recognized seasonal patterns.
